description: The Ultimate SmartMax set for the classroom or the bedroom! SmartMax Build & Learn features 100 building pieces and a container that is a sturdy storage unit - and much more! Both the lid and the bottom of the container each offer unique building grids to help you on your way to building original and colourful structures. Colourful building guides are also included. Age: 1+ Inside the box Contains 100 pieces:- 48 short bars 8 curved bars 18 long bars 26 magnetic balls and 2 colourful instruction guides with a range of models.

SmartMax Build & Learn 100 Pieces The Ultimate Creative Builder for Little Engineers! Get ready for an explosion of fun and learning with the SmartMax Build & Learn 100 Pieces set, designed to ignite the imaginations of your little ones aged one and up! This isn't just any building toy; it's a gateway to endless discovery and a fantastic way for the whole family to bond through play. Inside this generous set, you'll find a treasure trove of 100 vibrant, engaging pieces that are perfectly sized for tiny hands. Imagine the incredible creations you can build with 48 short bars, 8 wonderfully curved bars that add dynamic flow to your designs, and 18 long bars for grander structures. To bring your visions to life, there are 26 sturdy magnetic balls that connect everything with satisfying clicks, making building a breeze and wonderfully safe. But the fun doesn't stop there! This set comes with a super-sturdy storage container that’s more than just a place to keep your pieces tidy. Oh no, this container is a building surface in itself! Both the lid and the bottom are cleverly designed with unique building grids, providing a fantastic foundation and a clear starting point for constructing your first marvelous creations or adding extra levels to your existing masterpieces. The included colorful building guides are packed with inspiring ideas and a range of amazing models to get you started, helping young builders learn as they play and experiment with different shapes and connections. This hands-on experience promotes essential developmental skills like problem-solving, spatial reasoning, and fine motor control, all while keeping the mood light and joyful. The magnetic connections are a marvel, allowing for effortless assembly and disassembly, so your little architect can rebuild and redesign their dreams as often as they like. Whether you're looking for an engaging activity for a rainy day, a stimulating educational tool for the playroom, or a wonderful gift that keeps on giving, the SmartMax Build & Learn 100 Pieces set is an absolute winner. It’s designed to grow with your child, offering new challenges and creative opportunities as they get older and their building ambitions expand. Dive into a world of colorful construction, where every magnetic connection brings you closer to a finished marvel, and every playtime session is an adventure in learning and family fun. This set encourages collaborative play, allowing siblings or parents and children to work together, share ideas, and celebrate their collective achievements. The bright colors and satisfying tactile experience of the pieces make it an irresistible invitation to explore and build. It’s more than just a toy; it’s a tool for fostering creativity, encouraging critical thinking, and creating precious family memories, one magnetic build at a time.

description: Bundled to help the conservation of solitary bees and other pollinators, contains; The Bee Barn Natural Nesting Hay A pack of nectar-rich Wildflower Seeds Our latest Conservation Guide on Bees Lovingly packed in our Gift Box Firstly, For the love of Bees gift pack contains a charming, customer favourite ‘Bee Barn’. Produced from sustainably managed, wood, with a recycled second-life plastic frontage. Designed to attract, solitary bees and other species of pollinators and insects. The barn also offers shelter and a space to create homes for these creatures in the various sections. This Bee Barn comes in an attractive gift box and is easy to put up and maintain. Many other pollinators may nest in the bee barn, but they will require some nesting material. Nesting material can fit in the lower compartment. As they often like to adopt ready-made nests from other creatures, such as birds. Secondly, the bundle also contains natural nesting hay for the ‘Bee Barn’. As well as a pack of seeds to grow colourful nectar-rich wildflowers that attract and feed bees. Plus, our latest conservation guide on Bees. This Gift Bundle is the perfect gift for your nature-loving friends and family. You’ll be helping them create a cosy home for solitary bees in their gardens and outdoor spaces. Therefore, continuing the much-needed conservation of our friendly pollinators!

description: Supercharge your memory with the Genius version of our best-selling, electronic, light-up memory game, BrainBolt®! Watch as up to 21 lights flash at random, then challenge your brain to repeat the patterns without missing a beat. Five new genius levels, randomised patterns, and solo or head-to-head modes make this portable hand-held brain bender the perfect way to play – at home or on the go! If you loved and conquered original BrainBolt, then level up your memory skills with BrainBolt Genius, the brain teaser that’s so much fun, you won’t be able to put it down! There are all-new game modes, three colours of LED lights, and colour-coded multiplayer gameplay. Train your brain! BrainBolt Genius starts off with a simple sequence, but it gets longer and more complicated as the games continue. Playing this fun hand-held electronic game improves memory and cognitive skills, develops hand-eye coordination, and builds problem-solving skills, visual scanning skills, and more. This portable, hand-held light-up game is perfect for planes, trains, road trips, waiting rooms, or anywhere you train your brain. There are two volume settings so young geniuses can play without the sound on. It’s addictive, puzzle-playing fun for players ages 7 to 107! Requires 3AAA batteries not included. Suitable for ages 7+

description:
Grab your tools, it’s time to get building! Learn how to use tools and build your own workbench with this introductory mechanical engineering kit for kids ages three and up. Join Ty and Karlie — the young engineers featured in the other Kids First early engineering kits — to learn how to use a hammer, screwdriver, and wrench, and the basic engineering principles behind how these tools work.

 This kit features large tools that are comfortable for kids to hold, while also being lightweight and safe. In addition to the workbench, build five other awesome models with the included modular building parts, including a race car, airplane, house, scissors, and a toolbox to carry your tools. Then let your imagination run wild and build your own creations!
 Intro to Tools & Building is a fun and engaging way to teach simple engineering concepts to young children, allowing parents, teachers, and caregivers to lay the groundwork for strong STEM-related skills and comprehension at an early age. Model building helps develop fine motor skills, mechanical engineering skills, visual-spatial skills, and reasoning and concept development skills. The parts in this kit are compatible with the parts of other Thames & Kosmos Kids First engineering kits.

title: My First Coding and Robotics: Build & Code Fun Robots, Easy Card Programming for Kids Ages 4-8, No Computer Needed STEM Learning Toy
My First Coding and Robotics
description: My First Coding and Robotics Kit: A Fun Journey into Programming and Engineering! Get ready for an exciting adventure into the world of coding and robotics with the My First Coding and Robotics Kit! This fantastic set is designed to introduce young minds, ages 4 to 8, to the fundamentals of programming in a super engaging and hands-on way. Forget about needing screens or complex devices; this kit uses clever physical code cards that your adorable robot pal, Sammy, reads with its special optical identifier sensor on its underside. Simply lay out a sequence of these code cards, and watch as Sammy understands its mission! Once programmed, place Sammy on a grid made of map cards, and get ready to see your creations come to life! Sammy can be programmed to zoom in different directions, activate its integrated output gear for fun moving parts like arms, flash its colorful LED lights, and even play cheerful sounds. The possibilities are endless as your child learns to think like a programmer and an engineer. The built-in output gear is a game-changer, allowing kids to build simple robotic creations that respond to their coded commands, fostering creativity and a sense of accomplishment. This kit is more than just play; it's a brilliant introduction to physical engineering and essential problem-solving skills through a series of progressively challenging building and coding lessons. These 30 illustrated lessons are expertly crafted and aligned with important computer science education standards from organizations like CSTA and ISTE, and even courses from Code.org, ensuring a valuable learning experience. The full-color illustrated manual, which can be accessed online for convenience, provides step-by-step guidance for both coding lessons and model assembly, making it perfect for adult-child collaboration or independent exploration for older kids. The lessons cleverly cover six key coding areas: sequencing, loops, events, conditionals, functions, and variables, all presented in a way that feels like fun and discovery. Sammy isn't the only star; the kit includes five other engaging stories with related model-building and coding challenges. Imagine a mouse navigating a maze to find cheese, a penguin exploring a zoo, a soccer player scoring a goal, a fire truck bravely putting out a blaze, or a factory robot efficiently completing its tasks. Each scenario provides a unique context for applying learned coding concepts. To power Sammy's adventures, you'll need 3 AA batteries, which are conveniently supplied separately. This kit truly makes learning about technology an enjoyable and accessible experience for the whole family.

My First Coding and Robotics is a brilliant starter kit to teach coding principles with a cute little robot. You don’t need a tablet, smartphone, or computer to program this robot; programs are created by simply laying down a sequence of physical code cards.

 As the robot drives over the code cards, an Optical identifier sensor or optical scanner on the bottom of the robot, reads the code cards one by one and loads the program. Next, place the robot on a grid made of map cards, and the robot runs the program. You can program the robot to move in different directions, activate its output gear, light up its LED, play sounds, and respond to different function cards. The integrated output gear makes it possible to build simple robotic creations with arms or other moving parts that respond according to the program’s instructions.

 This robot kit also teaches physical engineering and problem solving skills through a series of building and coding lessons. The 30 lessons are aligned with standards for computer science education developed by the Computer Science Teachers Association (CSTA) and the International Society for Technology (ISTE) Education, as well as courses from Code.org.

 The lessons or activities progress in complexity through the illustrated manual, allowing the kit to be appropriate for a child as young as four years with help from an adult and as old as eight years. The lessons cover these six key areas in coding: sequencing, loops, events, conditionals, functions, and variables.

 In addition to Sammy (the robot), there are five other stories, each with a series of model-building and coding challenges and lessons related to it: a mouse moves through a maze to find cheese; a penguin wanders around a zoo; a soccer player moves a ball into the goal; a fire truck puts out a fire; and a factory robot performs tasks in a factory scene. A full-colour illustrated manual guides (https://www.thamesandkosmos.com/manuals/full/567012_Kids-First-Coding&Robotics-Manual.pdf) users through the coding lessons and the assembly of the different models.

 Requires 3 AA batteries, supplied separately.

 Ages 4 to 8 years.

title: SmartMax Build & Learn 100 pieces
Smart Games SmartMax Build & Learn 100 Piece Magnetic Building Set for Kids Ages 1+ with Educational Blocks and Storage Container
description: The Ultimate SmartMax set for the classroom or the bedroom! SmartMax Build & Learn features 100 building pieces and a container that is a sturdy storage unit - and much more! Both the lid and the bottom of the container each offer unique building grids to help you on your way to building original and colourful structures. Colourful building guides are also included. Age: 1+ Inside the box Contains 100 pieces:- 48 short bars 8 curved bars 18 long bars 26 magnetic balls and 2 colourful instruction guides with a range of models.

SmartMax Build & Learn 100 Pieces The Ultimate Creative Builder for Little Engineers! Get ready for an explosion of fun and learning with the SmartMax Build & Learn 100 Pieces set, designed to ignite the imaginations of your little ones aged one and up! This isn't just any building toy; it's a gateway to endless discovery and a fantastic way for the whole family to bond through play. Inside this generous set, you'll find a treasure trove of 100 vibrant, engaging pieces that are perfectly sized for tiny hands. Imagine the incredible creations you can build with 48 short bars, 8 wonderfully curved bars that add dynamic flow to your designs, and 18 long bars for grander structures. To bring your visions to life, there are 26 sturdy magnetic balls that connect everything with satisfying clicks, making building a breeze and wonderfully safe. But the fun doesn't stop there! This set comes with a super-sturdy storage container that’s more than just a place to keep your pieces tidy. Oh no, this container is a building surface in itself! Both the lid and the bottom are cleverly designed with unique building grids, providing a fantastic foundation and a clear starting point for constructing your first marvelous creations or adding extra levels to your existing masterpieces. The included colorful building guides are packed with inspiring ideas and a range of amazing models to get you started, helping young builders learn as they play and experiment with different shapes and connections. This hands-on experience promotes essential developmental skills like problem-solving, spatial reasoning, and fine motor control, all while keeping the mood light and joyful. The magnetic connections are a marvel, allowing for effortless assembly and disassembly, so your little architect can rebuild and redesign their dreams as often as they like. Whether you're looking for an engaging activity for a rainy day, a stimulating educational tool for the playroom, or a wonderful gift that keeps on giving, the SmartMax Build & Learn 100 Pieces set is an absolute winner. It’s designed to grow with your child, offering new challenges and creative opportunities as they get older and their building ambitions expand. Dive into a world of colorful construction, where every magnetic connection brings you closer to a finished marvel, and every playtime session is an adventure in learning and family fun. This set encourages collaborative play, allowing siblings or parents and children to work together, share ideas, and celebrate their collective achievements. The bright colors and satisfying tactile experience of the pieces make it an irresistible invitation to explore and build. It’s more than just a toy; it’s a tool for fostering creativity, encouraging critical thinking, and creating precious family memories, one magnetic build at a time.

Produced from sustainably managed, wood, with a recycled second-life plastic frontage. Designed to attract, solitary bees and other species of pollinators and insects. The barn also offers shelter and a space to create homes for these creatures in the various sections. This Bee Barn comes in an attractive gift box and is easy to put up and maintain. Many other pollinators may nest in the bee barn, but they will require some nesting material. Nesting material can fit in the lower compartment. As they often like to adopt ready-made nests from other creatures, such as birds. Secondly, the bundle also contains natural nesting hay for the ‘Bee Barn’. title: My First Coding and Robotics: Build & Code Fun Robots, Easy Card Programming for Kids Ages 4-8, No Computer Needed STEM Learning Toy
My First Coding and Robotics
description: My First Coding and Robotics Kit: A Fun Journey into Programming and Engineering! Get ready for an exciting adventure into the world of coding and robotics with the My First Coding and Robotics Kit! This fantastic set is designed to introduce young minds, ages 4 to 8, to the fundamentals of programming in a super engaging and hands-on way. Forget about needing screens or complex devices; this kit uses clever physical code cards that your adorable robot pal, Sammy, reads with its special optical identifier sensor on its underside. Simply lay out a sequence of these code cards, and watch as Sammy understands its mission! Once programmed, place Sammy on a grid made of map cards, and get ready to see your creations come to life! Sammy can be programmed to zoom in different directions, activate its integrated output gear for fun moving parts like arms, flash its colorful LED lights, and even play cheerful sounds. The possibilities are endless as your child learns to think like a programmer and an engineer. The built-in output gear is a game-changer, allowing kids to build simple robotic creations that respond to their coded commands, fostering creativity and a sense of accomplishment. This kit is more than just play; it's a brilliant introduction to physical engineering and essential problem-solving skills through a series of progressively challenging building and coding lessons. These 30 illustrated lessons are expertly crafted and aligned with important computer science education standards from organizations like CSTA and ISTE, and even courses from Code.org, ensuring a valuable learning experience. The full-color illustrated manual, which can be accessed online for convenience, provides step-by-step guidance for both coding lessons and model assembly, making it perfect for adult-child collaboration or independent exploration for older kids. The lessons cleverly cover six key coding areas: sequencing, loops, events, conditionals, functions, and variables, all presented in a way that feels like fun and discovery. Sammy isn't the only star; the kit includes five other engaging stories with related model-building and coding challenges. Imagine a mouse navigating a maze to find cheese, a penguin exploring a zoo, a soccer player scoring a goal, a fire truck bravely putting out a blaze, or a factory robot efficiently completing its tasks. Each scenario provides a unique context for applying learned coding concepts. To power Sammy's adventures, you'll need 3 AA batteries, which are conveniently supplied separately. This kit truly makes learning about technology an enjoyable and accessible experience for the whole family.

My First Coding and Robotics is a brilliant starter kit to teach coding principles with a cute little robot. You don’t need a tablet, smartphone, or computer to program this robot; programs are created by simply laying down a sequence of physical code cards.

 As the robot drives over the code cards, an Optical identifier sensor or optical scanner on the bottom of the robot, reads the code cards one by one and loads the program. Next, place the robot on a grid made of map cards, and the robot runs the program. You can program the robot to move in different directions, activate its output gear, light up its LED, play sounds, and respond to different function cards. The integrated output gear makes it possible to build simple robotic creations with arms or other moving parts that respond according to the program’s instructions.

 This robot kit also teaches physical engineering and problem solving skills through a series of building and coding lessons. The 30 lessons are aligned with standards for computer science education developed by the Computer Science Teachers Association (CSTA) and the International Society for Technology (ISTE) Education, as well as courses from Code.org.

 The lessons or activities progress in complexity through the illustrated manual, allowing the kit to be appropriate for a child as young as four years with help from an adult and as old as eight years. The lessons cover these six key areas in coding: sequencing, loops, events, conditionals, functions, and variables.

 In addition to Sammy (the robot), there are five other stories, each with a series of model-building and coding challenges and lessons related to it: a mouse moves through a maze to find cheese; a penguin wanders around a zoo; a soccer player moves a ball into the goal; a fire truck puts out a fire; and a factory robot performs tasks in a factory scene. A full-colour illustrated manual guides (https://www.thamesandkosmos.com/manuals/full/567012_Kids-First-Coding&Robotics-Manual.pdf) users through the coding lessons and the assembly of the different models.

 Requires 3 AA batteries, supplied separately.

 Ages 4 to 8 years.

Build Your Roboformer!  A car that can be turned into a robot... Just what your child dreamed of.

description: The Ultimate SmartMax set for the classroom or the bedroom! SmartMax Build & Learn features 100 building pieces and a container that is a sturdy storage unit - and much more! Both the lid and the bottom of the container each offer unique building grids to help you on your way to building original and colourful structures. Colourful building guides are also included. Age: 1+ Inside the box Contains 100 pieces:- 48 short bars 8 curved bars 18 long bars 26 magnetic balls and 2 colourful instruction guides with a range of models.

SmartMax Build & Learn 100 Pieces The Ultimate Creative Builder for Little Engineers! Get ready for an explosion of fun and learning with the SmartMax Build & Learn 100 Pieces set, designed to ignite the imaginations of your little ones aged one and up! This isn't just any building toy; it's a gateway to endless discovery and a fantastic way for the whole family to bond through play. Inside this generous set, you'll find a treasure trove of 100 vibrant, engaging pieces that are perfectly sized for tiny hands. Imagine the incredible creations you can build with 48 short bars, 8 wonderfully curved bars that add dynamic flow to your designs, and 18 long bars for grander structures. To bring your visions to life, there are 26 sturdy magnetic balls that connect everything with satisfying clicks, making building a breeze and wonderfully safe. But the fun doesn't stop there! This set comes with a super-sturdy storage container that’s more than just a place to keep your pieces tidy. Oh no, this container is a building surface in itself! Both the lid and the bottom are cleverly designed with unique building grids, providing a fantastic foundation and a clear starting point for constructing your first marvelous creations or adding extra levels to your existing masterpieces. The included colorful building guides are packed with inspiring ideas and a range of amazing models to get you started, helping young builders learn as they play and experiment with different shapes and connections. This hands-on experience promotes essential developmental skills like problem-solving, spatial reasoning, and fine motor control, all while keeping the mood light and joyful. The magnetic connections are a marvel, allowing for effortless assembly and disassembly, so your little architect can rebuild and redesign their dreams as often as they like. Whether you're looking for an engaging activity for a rainy day, a stimulating educational tool for the playroom, or a wonderful gift that keeps on giving, the SmartMax Build & Learn 100 Pieces set is an absolute winner. It’s designed to grow with your child, offering new challenges and creative opportunities as they get older and their building ambitions expand. Dive into a world of colorful construction, where every magnetic connection brings you closer to a finished marvel, and every playtime session is an adventure in learning and family fun. This set encourages collaborative play, allowing siblings or parents and children to work together, share ideas, and celebrate their collective achievements. The bright colors and satisfying tactile experience of the pieces make it an irresistible invitation to explore and build. It’s more than just a toy; it’s a tool for fostering creativity, encouraging critical thinking, and creating precious family memories, one magnetic build at a time.

description: Bundled to help the conservation of solitary bees and other pollinators, contains; The Bee Barn Natural Nesting Hay A pack of nectar-rich Wildflower Seeds Our latest Conservation Guide on Bees Lovingly packed in our Gift Box Firstly, For the love of Bees gift pack contains a charming, customer favourite ‘Bee Barn’. Produced from sustainably managed, wood, with a recycled second-life plastic frontage. Designed to attract, solitary bees and other species of pollinators and insects. The barn also offers shelter and a space to create homes for these creatures in the various sections. This Bee Barn comes in an attractive gift box and is easy to put up and maintain. Many other pollinators may nest in the bee barn, but they will require some nesting material. Nesting material can fit in the lower compartment. As they often like to adopt ready-made nests from other creatures, such as birds. Secondly, the bundle also contains natural nesting hay for the ‘Bee Barn’. As well as a pack of seeds to grow colourful nectar-rich wildflowers that attract and feed bees. Plus, our latest conservation guide on Bees. This Gift Bundle is the perfect gift for your nature-loving friends and family. You’ll be helping them create a cosy home for solitary bees in their gardens and outdoor spaces. Therefore, continuing the much-needed conservation of our friendly pollinators!

description: Supercharge your memory with the Genius version of our best-selling, electronic, light-up memory game, BrainBolt®! Watch as up to 21 lights flash at random, then challenge your brain to repeat the patterns without missing a beat. Five new genius levels, randomised patterns, and solo or head-to-head modes make this portable hand-held brain bender the perfect way to play – at home or on the go! If you loved and conquered original BrainBolt, then level up your memory skills with BrainBolt Genius, the brain teaser that’s so much fun, you won’t be able to put it down! There are all-new game modes, three colours of LED lights, and colour-coded multiplayer gameplay. Train your brain! BrainBolt Genius starts off with a simple sequence, but it gets longer and more complicated as the games continue. Playing this fun hand-held electronic game improves memory and cognitive skills, develops hand-eye coordination, and builds problem-solving skills, visual scanning skills, and more. This portable, hand-held light-up game is perfect for planes, trains, road trips, waiting rooms, or anywhere you train your brain. There are two volume settings so young geniuses can play without the sound on. It’s addictive, puzzle-playing fun for players ages 7 to 107! Requires 3AAA batteries not included. Suitable for ages 7+

Grab your tools, it’s time to get building! Learn how to use tools and build your own workbench with this introductory mechanical engineering kit for kids ages three and up. Join Ty and Karlie — the young engineers featured in the other Kids First early engineering kits — to learn how to use a hammer, screwdriver, and wrench, and the basic engineering principles behind how these tools work.

 This kit features large tools that are comfortable for kids to hold, while also being lightweight and safe. In addition to the workbench, build five other awesome models with the included modular building parts, including a race car, airplane, house, scissors, and a toolbox to carry your tools. Then let your imagination run wild and build your own creations!
 Intro to Tools & Building is a fun and engaging way to teach simple engineering concepts to young children, allowing parents, teachers, and caregivers to lay the groundwork for strong STEM-related skills and comprehension at an early age. Model building helps develop fine motor skills, mechanical engineering skills, visual-spatial skills, and reasoning and concept development skills. The parts in this kit are compatible with the parts of other Thames & Kosmos Kids First engineering kits.

Produced from sustainably managed, wood, with a recycled second-life plastic frontage. Designed to attract, solitary bees and other species of pollinators and insects. The barn also offers shelter and a space to create homes for these creatures in the various sections. This Bee Barn comes in an attractive gift box and is easy to put up and maintain. Many other pollinators may nest in the bee barn, but they will require some nesting material. Nesting material can fit in the lower compartment. As they often like to adopt ready-made nests from other creatures, such as birds. Secondly, the bundle also contains natural nesting hay for the ‘Bee Barn’.
